poem:
Voices of Relief  
  
In the silence, a rumble—  
steel saviors crawl, laden,  
bearing hopes in burlap  
through walls torn  
by man's ceaseless discord.  
  
Khartoum waits, breath held,  
as the convoy's lifeblood  
slakes the dust,  
each grain a promise,  
each wheel a prayer,  
each drop—a world reborn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sudan: first aid convoy reaches besieged Khartoum area since start of civil war An aid convoy has reached a besieged area of Khartoum for the first time since Sudan’s civil war broke out in April 2023, bringing food and medicines in a country where half of people are at risk of starvation. The 28 trucks arrived in southern Khartoum on 25 December, according to the World Food Programme (WFP), which provided 22 trucks loaded with". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
